title: Liverpool's Andy Robertson provides injury update ahead of clash with Tottenham
text:

Liverpool's Andy Robertson has moved to allay any fears he will not be fit to face Tottenham at the weekend after hobbling out of the Reds' win over Genk.

The left-back was substituted just over an hour into Wednesday's clash, and walked gingerly round the pitch perimeter back to the dugout.

Boss Jurgen Klopp was forced to bring on Joe Gomez as a replacement and switch James Milner to the left flank with Liverpool 2-0 ahead.

But Robertson has seemingly confirmed there are no serious issues and will be available for Sunday's match with Spurs.

The Athletic's James Pearce asked Robertson after the match whether he will be fit for the tie, to which the defender replied: "All good."

(Image: Getty Images)

It will be a sigh of relief for Klopp, who is already facing injury problems in his defence.

Trent Alexander-Arnold missed the Champions League group stage match due to a viral illness, while Joel Matip was also ruled out due to a recurrence of the injury that kept him out of two matches earlier this month.

Klopp said prior to the Genk clash: "Trent is ill and Joel is not ready. It is just a little thing which usually settles in the two weeks [Matip] had; it did, but then it came up after the United game and so now we just have to make sure this time it settles finally, that’s all.

"It is not a massive injury, it’s just a bit annoying for him and he cannot do it [face Genk]."

Alexander-Arnold is expected to be fit in time for Sunday's match at Anfield which will be the first time the Reds have faced Tottenham since their Champions League final showdown in June.

Both sides had high-scoring wins in the competition this week, with Spurs beating Red Star Belgrade 5-0 and Liverpool getting a 4-1 victory in Belgium.

Two goals from Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain put the Reds in a commanding position against Genk, before Sadio Mane and Mohamed Salah added to the tally, followed by a late consolation for the hosts.
description: The Reds defender was substituted an hour into the Champions League clash with Genk on Wednesday
